problems.title: Minimum Cost to Connect All Ropes
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have N ropes with different lengths.
You need to connect all ropes into one rope.

The cost to connect two ropes of lengths A and B is A + B.
This operation produces a new rope of length A + B.

Find the minimum total cost to connect all ropes.

Greedy Insight: Always connect the two shortest ropes first!
This minimizes the number of times each original length contributes to future costs.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
4 3 2 6

Sample Output
29

Explanation:
Ropes: [4, 3, 2, 6]

Step 1: Connect 2 and 3 -> Cost = 5, Ropes: [4, 5, 6]
Step 2: Connect 4 and 5 -> Cost = 9, Ropes: [9, 6]
Step 3: Connect 6 and 9 -> Cost = 15, Ropes: [15]

Total Cost = 5 + 9 + 15 = 29

hintsList: This is equivalent to Huffman coding! The minimum cost is achieved by always merging the two smallest elements.
Use a min-heap. Pop two smallest, add their sum to cost, push the sum back. Continue until one element remains.
